website_summaries.verdict: Durable and lightweight aluminum frame is perfect for road riding. 16 speeds for varying terrain.
pros: Offered in 3 different sizes and 2 color schemes, so you have some desirable choices
Includes 16 speeds, so you can deal with hills when needed
Aluminum frame is lightweight, yet durable
Fork consists of high tensile steel for greater strength
cons: Will need to be assembled at arrival
Larger sized bikes are very expensive

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase when shipped free with Prime.
customer_reviews.text: I've only put about 50 miles on this bike. So far, it is great. I've only ridden hybrid bikes in the past, but this is so much smoother and easier to ride I'm glad I bought it. I was looking for something to commute to work once a week (25 mile round trip), but didn't want to spend more than 500-600 dollars. I even tuned it up myself using videos on youtube and it shifts beautifully. Brakes aren't bad, despite some reviews I read. Shipped for free with Amazon Prime, I'm out the door for $429. Highly recommend for someone on the fence that doesn't want to drop huge money.
customer_reviews.author: Derek H.

customer_reviews.title: 1,000 miles with no mechanical faults
customer_reviews.text: Just logged my first 1,000 miles (1,609km) on my Libero. With no mechanical faults. Got this bike to ride around town. Ended up taking up cycling last summer. Was able to keep up on club rides, and with friends on their Cannondales, and Pinarellos. Only replaced the pedals. It's been a great entry level bike! Just got new tires to save weight. Side note: last year they had the white, and red color scheme for the Libero. Which was much more attractive.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Hejna

customer_reviews.title: Great open road; Almost great in the city.
customer_reviews.text: I ~probably~ ordered the bike one size too large, but I'm adjusting... Assembly was easy, and once it was tuned up & adjusted by a local shop, works quite well. The shifting mechanism is very different from anything I had before, but easy to get used to after a bit. Only real complaint I have is the lack of 'inner' break handles, forcing you to always lean forward in urban areas where traffic requires sudden breaking to slow down or stop completely. If that's a concern, I'd recommend another bike or (as I now am) plan to replace. In rural areas, however, this isn't really a problem; If my riding was 100% rural, I'd have gone full 5-stars.
customer_reviews.author: James L Domsalla

customer_reviews.title: Total satisfaction!
customer_reviews.text: Love this bike, so pleased with the comfort and easy shifting. I did take it to REI to adjust it, have it set up and fit my measurement. But such a great buy for a beginner road bike. Although the breaking system takes a while and slightly more distance to a complete stop. But would I purchase this bike again? ABSOLUTELY!!
customer_reviews.author: NommyWan

customer_reviews.title: Basic For Budget
customer_reviews.text: If I had five grand to spend, sure, I would have purchased a different bike. But since I'm getting back into road riding, don't have a butt-load of cash, and don't want to be strapped with something I potentially wont use, the Giordano Libero fits the bill--so far. I've only had it a month, but here are some components you'll want to address: Brakes=suck. The pads hit the rim at an odd angle...look to replace. The seat=formally a torture devise in the Spanish civil war. Seriously. Spend an hour on this baby and you'll be speaking in tongues. It is not adjustable...look to replace. The rest of the bike=pretty damn good, I must say.
customer_reviews.author: drex

customer_reviews.title: It's aight.
customer_reviews.text: I've been riding the Bicycle pretty regularly for about ~1 year. It rides decent enough and looks good. The pop-off tires making changing them a lot easier; just buy a cable along with a U-Lock to lock-up. The gears shift poorly is only downside (noticeable 'clunk' each time), but I think correlates with the price fair. Decent low-mid range road bicycle for commuting and daily rides.
customer_reviews.author: Cameron

customer_reviews.title: just got it
customer_reviews.text: My gut feeling review of the bike after it arrived tonight: Good bike, great price. It's a great deal, but the price was arrived at by the makers by the simple expedient of going cheap on parts likely to get replaced anyway by the new owner -- 1) stem is crap 2 bolt, ditch it a.s.a.p. (may want new handlebar too.) 2) Chainrings are cheap stamped, riveted crap, and heavier than necessary. Dump it as soon as able. otherwise a fine deal and I am happy thus far.
customer_reviews.author: Lance Cozad

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful quality bike
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful quality bike. Great bike for anybody. Easy to put together and had no defects or scratches upon arrival. Completed minor adjustments to the brakes and gears so the chain would no longer make noise. From box to road ready in just over an hour. Have had no trouble with it yet and rode it the whole summer. Normal valve stems and can be pumped up with any regular inflator.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Sperfslage

customer_reviews.title: Perfect bike for those wanting to test out the road ...
customer_reviews.text: Perfect bike for those wanting to test out the road cycling scene without spending too muh money. You can get this bike and all necessary accessories (helmet, gloves, padded shorts, tube, tools, tire levers, bottle rack, phone case, and saddle bag) for well under the cost of a USED name brand road bike. I've put over 400 miles on this bike and have enjoyed every ride. My biggest complaint are the brakes. I ride mainly on paved trails 30-50 mile rides. PROS: - VALUE! - Reliable CONS: - Brakes (easily upgraded)
customer_reviews.author: Prime

customer_reviews.title: Also the brakes are not good.. It does not catch too well
customer_reviews.text: The pedals seem to be cheap, they are small and I feel that they are going to break.. I need to upgrade the pedals.. Also the brakes are not good.. It does not catch too well.. I need to upgrade that.. The tires look kind of cheap, i am not sure about that.. Other than that, the bike is nice and fast, the frame is solid... I am 6 feet and I feel it fits a little small but works ok... so yea cheap pedals, cheap brakes on my observation..
customer_reviews.author: Michael Stambaugh

customer_reviews.title: Unhappy
customer_reviews.text: I really don't like the bike. The brakes are horrible. The pedal is not good. The handle bar is uncomfortable. I wish I could return it but I'm 2 weeks past my return date. I paid 60 dollars to get the bike gears tuned and brakes adjusted. After riding one time. The brake lever stopped working. Only have a total of 19 miles on this bike and the rear wheel keeps making loud noises for some reason. It just sucks I missed the return date.
customer_reviews.author: Zamir

customer_reviews.title: Good starter bike
customer_reviews.text: I bought the 20 inch frame. I am 5 foot 8 inches and the 20 inch fits perfectly. I have put 500 miles on this bike so far. It is not the greatest bike for climbing up hill, needs a bigger cassette for that. I also needed to change the brake calipers, they were quite weak when I got the bike and unable to make the adjustment on the caliper. I recommend a tune up as soon as you get the bike. I also had to replace the floral grips on the handle bars. The ride is a little stiffer than expected. Otherwise, it's a good bike for starters.
customer_reviews.author: Love

customer_reviews.title: my first road bike
customer_reviews.text: i really like this bike Assembly wasn't all that hard it's pretty light i've been riding a Mountain bike for the past year and what a difference i'm thinking my 28 minute commute will be cut in half NOT! lol. Also i should have gotten the '22 frame this comes right up to my sack and i don't like the white tape it got dirty while i was putting the bike together i'll replace it with black tape One bad note FedEX delivered the box while i wasn't home and left it in my back yard
customer_reviews.author: Frank L. Gadson

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit, easy to put together and I would ...
customer_reviews.text: My son (age 14) is a Boy Scout, he borrowed a ride bike for a 300 mile bike ride (done in 1 week with over night camping) SO PROUD OF THESE YOUNG MEN the Scouts went on this summer (700 miles total with training rides) and after the ride he was hooked, so Santa (LOL) brought him this bike for Christmas and he loves it!!! Perfect fit, easy to put together and I would recommend this bike to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: Mala Quatman

customer_reviews.title: Love how light it is
customer_reviews.text: Love how light it is. However, the brakes are pretty cheap and the front brakes didn't work after building it. Plan on taking it to a local bike shop and see what they suggest I do. I did watch a YouTube video on how to adjust and fix the brakes (which worked) but after riding it the front brakes felt a little too uneasy. Also love the color, nice looking bike.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Van Every

customer_reviews.title: low quality, bad customer support
customer_reviews.text: after only 1 month ride, the screw thread on crank arm is broken, have to replace whole crank arm to install the paddle. Send them emails, agreed send part, but never get it. Send them email again, no any feedback. Now, my $4xx NEW bike need more than $100 to be fixed.
customer_reviews.author: Yi Ding

customer_reviews.title: Great Beginners Model
customer_reviews.text: This is my first road bike and after reading reviews and searching online I decided to get this model. I am a girl about 5'4" but I have long legs so I feel the small is a right fit. Assembly is pretty easy. I had some trouble adjusting the l/h gear but with some help I got the gears to change smoothly. I love the colors and the feel. I totally recommend this bike to anyone starting out. It's a great deal too from what I have seen.
customer_reviews.author: Jules

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding entry level bike!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted an entry level road bike and went around to a few LBS in my area and the least I was quoted for a bike was 1,200. I decided to give this bike a try and have not been disappointed. I took it to a LBS and had them run through it and get it ready for the road. Brakes are the first thing I would change. I'm 5'6' with a 28" inseam and the small was still a somewhat big for me. Great bike for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Tori

customer_reviews.title: Great beginners bike
customer_reviews.text: Obviously not the best bike, may not fit perfectly, but for a beginning bike i think it is great. I am not riding across the country, but have gone on thirty mile rides. I did get a new seat, but that is it. I am 6'1" and the bike seemed just fine to me (beginner). If i keep rising i will upgrade at some point, but just want to make sure i like riding before i spend the big bucks
customer_reviews.author: T. Jones

customer_reviews.title: An entry level beast.
customer_reviews.text: Great entry level bike. I see a lot of people saying it's so heavy blah blah blah, it's really not very heavy for an entry level bike, if you're just going to use it casually or do benefit rides. Comes with flat pedals, you'll have to buy clip ins if you want them. I'm only giving it 4 out of 5 stars because of the terrible tires and the brakes that come with it.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Ehret

customer_reviews.title: Giordano road bike
customer_reviews.text: Good bike for the price. Had an issue with the front tire leaking air initially but we were finally able to get the issue resolved. My only other issue is at times the seat wants to point down and I have to keep screwing the bolt tight. Haven't had to in a few rides, some ar so good.
customer_reviews.author: MG

customer_reviews.title: Love it. You will too
customer_reviews.text: Love it. You will too. Worth it... and it gets you into biking without breaking the bank. Plus the name of the brand is also a famous pizza shop in Chicago. I make jokes that I'm sponsored by pizza.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great bike
customer_reviews.text: I plan on entering some sprint triathlons and needed a bike. I did a lot of research and was told that if purchasing an inexpensive road bike to buy one with a light weight frame as other parts could be swapped out later. That is why I chose this over other inexpensive models. When I reveived the bike, I put it together and had a shop adjust the brakes and the derailers. I would have given 5 stars but the seat is very uncomfortable which I am planning on switching out at some point. For now, I currently place a cloth over it while riding on my indoor trainer.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Cheapest with integrated brake levers, brakes themselves are terrible.
customer_reviews.text: As a new rider I like pretty much everything about the bike so far. My main criteria when buying this was essentially the cheapest thing I could get with integrated brakes levers. That said, the brakes themselves are really bad. Not that they don't brake satisfactorily but they don't stay in one location and will rub against the wheel and are essentially impossible to fix. I plan on replacing them with something else next season.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Giminiani

customer_reviews.title: Great bike. Rides well
customer_reviews.text: Great bike. Rides well. I assembled mine and then took it into my LBS to get a tune-up. Brakes do seem a little wonky in the sense that they are not as responsive as I'd like them to be, but I don't notice it anymore. This is a great bike for someone getting into or just interested in road cycling, like me! I changed nothing out of the box (i.e. saddle, tires). I really love my back and its a great change of look from all the lacked out bikes that are currently trending.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Jencyowski

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this bike after looking for an entry level road bike for sometime. The bike came packaged well and I had a local bike store assemble it for me. They where very impressed with the quality of the bike for the money. In fact the owner is going to look into carrying the bike at his store. The bike itself looks better in person. Took it for a spin and it rides great. I love the brake shifting. I would highly recommend for someone looking for a starter road bike a decent price.
customer_reviews.author: JCM

customer_reviews.title: Great Ride for the Money
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this bike as a starter seeking a healthier lifestyle. I researched several bikes in this price range and decided on this one based on other reviews I've read. Overall I love it! It's very light, comfortable to ride, and virtually no resistance when peddling. My only dislike is the breaks. I don't feel I can stop on a dime if I needed too. That being said, I've been riding it a lot and it's not a big concern. I do feel safe on it. I'm going to see if I can adjust the breaks for better performance, or simple replace them. It is a great bike and I definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: A. Paccione

customer_reviews.title: For less than 500$ go for it the brakes are subpar but over all its well worth it 70mile trip on her today if Gina dies I'll buy another great looking bike seat does suck
customer_reviews.text: Im loving this bike!!! For less than 500$ go for it the brakes are subpar but over all its well worth it 70mile trip on her today if Gina dies I'll buy another great looking bike seat does suck though
customer_reviews.author: levi a.

customer_reviews.title: I have enjoyed this bike very much
customer_reviews.text: I have enjoyed this bike very much. I ride smoothly had different hand positions. For the price and ho it has worked for me it has been an amazing bike. The kick stand raddles a lot so i removed it. Other than that it has been wonderful. I have ridden about 126 miles with it and it hasn't given me any problems.
customer_reviews.author: natashia McMullin

customer_reviews.title: Great entry road bike to begin cycling
customer_reviews.text: Bought this bike to get into road cycling. Great quality bike and the assembly is fairly easy. Have 125 miles in so far and no issues. Unless your handy with bike calibration you'll need to get the brakes adjusted by a professional to make them work good. The stock tires are not great. I upgraded to better quality 28 tires and it made a big difference.
customer_reviews.author: Jay G.

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied!
customer_reviews.text: Really liked the Giordano. My other bike got destroyed in a car accident. So I wanted a another Low end road bike. So I tried the Giordano Libero. I changed the white handle bar tape to black. I changed out the rims and brakes. Looks really cool. The bike shipped really fast. Only minor assembly. I took it to a bike shop to get a tuneup. Would definitely recommend this bike if your looking for a entry level bike that's not going to set you back a lot of money
customer_reviews.author: Gman

customer_reviews.title: I love it! Perfect introduction to cycling for those looking to do so.
customer_reviews.text: For the price this purchase cannot be beat. The bike is lightweight, looks VERY good (the bike looks much better in-person), and has decent components. A few things: - The brakes are HORRIBLE. This should be the first upgrade when buying this bike. - The wheels should be the second upgrade... For >$400 I believe this to be best buy on the market for a beginner.
customer_reviews.author: Regatta03

customer_reviews.title: Great bike for the price
customer_reviews.text: The frame, the shifters and the crank-set are great. I would give this bike 5 stars, but it's a necessity that you change the tires soon after you buy this if you hope to keep riding it. The tubes popped a couple days after I put it together and the tires don't do much at all in the way of protecting the inner tubes. However, I replaced the tires with some Gatorskins and thorn resistant inner tubes and it works perfectly otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Wilkins

customer_reviews.title: Overall
customer_reviews.text: First road bike.. I love it... I was kind worried if it would support my weight (280lbs) it did great bike
customer_reviews.author: lionel smallwood

customer_reviews.title: Came with a bent crankset and really bad breaks.
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to get this bike. After getting it assembled and tuned at the shop, I was told that the crankset was bent, so it makes creaky noises when I peddle. Even after changing the break pads, the bike doesn't reliably break unless you really push the break levers very hard. I have already spent about $100 getting it assembled and tuned, and looking back, I should've gotten a nice used bike from a co-op instead. I feel like I'll have to sink in a lot more money for adjustments.
customer_reviews.author: Alongkorn Bongsudhiruks

customer_reviews.title: Broken front tube
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bike and the shipping was amazing it came in two days. The box was a little busted but everything was fine but the front tube was punctured at the stem of the valve. Who can I talk to, to get a replacement tube.
customer_reviews.author: Abu Belal

customer_reviews.title: Awesome bike!
customer_reviews.text: This is a excellent bike!! It's light (23lbs) and fast. It was super easy to assemble. The only problem I have is the front derailer shifter part grinds on the chain, I've tried adjusting it but can't get it right. Also the foot pegs are pretty cheap. Other than that the tires have been good so far, brakes aren't as bad as other reviews claim, they could be a lot worse. The integrated shifter are also awesome! I highly recommend this bike over ANY entry level bike and even some bikes in the $500-$800 range.
customer_reviews.author: J.J. Boyle

customer_reviews.title: Nice bike
customer_reviews.text: Not as light as I had hoped, but nice bike for the dollars. I was able to order a tall frame for me which is a big up. Components are ok , bike shifted fine out of the box. Assembly was easy.
customer_reviews.author: rjsailnsd

customer_reviews.title: I live in a river valley so the hills get pretty step, would be nice to have a few ...
customer_reviews.text: Solid bike, I've had it about 4 months now and use it to commute to and from work (2 miles each way). I haven't had any issues. I live in a river valley so the hills get pretty step, would be nice to have a few lower gears, but it is not too bad.
customer_reviews.author: Graham

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble, just had to adjust the rear derailleur after a few rides. Make sure all the screws on the entire bike are tight before riding. I went on a 50 mile bike ride right away and my handlebars got loose because I didn't tighten them when I first got the bike. Would definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Fernando Antuna

customer_reviews.title: Good Value for Basic Road Bike
customer_reviews.text: Out of the box, we had to take the bike into a local shop and spend $30 to adjust the rear derailer. We then took the bike to Tucson and completed the Mount Lemmon 'grind.' The bike perfromed very well and met our expectations. Seems strange to have Schrader tubes, but we didn't have any problems. So far, I would certainly recommend the bike as a good basic road bike.
customer_reviews.author: John Twyman

customer_reviews.title: Great bike for the price point.
customer_reviews.text: Really beautiful bike. It rides really smooth and very well made. I replaced the pedals with the XLC Alloy MTB / Trekking Pedal, Black and they made such a difference. Over all a really great bike for the price point Also, I'm 5'7" with an inseam of 31.25 and purchased the 54cc bike with is perfect for me.
customer_reviews.author: Marquis Holmes

customer_reviews.title: The bike is light weight and looks great. However
customer_reviews.text: The bike is light weight and looks great. However, the assembly of the brakes needed professional tweaking at a bike shop before using.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great bike for the money
customer_reviews.text: Have been riding a mountain bike for a long time and always wanted to try a road bike, but didn't want to pay $6 or 700 just to try it out. The bike was easier to put together than I thought, but did pay a local bike shop $50 to get the brakes and derailleurs set just right. My wife bought an entry level bike from a local shop and from what I can see it's not really any better than the Libero. Have put on a couple hundred miles and really enjoy it! I'm 6'4" and this bike is plenty big for me.
customer_reviews.author: Blair larson

customer_reviews.title: A beginner Road Bike...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the bike as a novice in biking. I have had this bike for less than a year and have enjoyed it. You can tell that the parts of the bike are relatively of lower quality but they withhold my abuse on the bike at 6 3" 270lbs. I would recommend this bike to others as a entry road bike.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Great bike for beginners
customer_reviews.text: Great bike for beginners. Not too expensive and designed and built really well. You may want to change the tires though after a few rides. Have been riding this for almost a year and it is great!
customer_reviews.author: NK2K3

customer_reviews.title: I can't wait to weekend to ride it.
customer_reviews.text: I read a lot of review and I'm coinciding with some those. I think the pedal could be better than the cheaper plastic one. the shipping was fast and clean. Over all, the road bike is exelent and smooth ride. I'm very happy with it. I can't wait to weekend to ride it.
customer_reviews.author: Gustavo Maruelli

customer_reviews.title: Good not great
customer_reviews.text: This bike is very nice /good for the entry level. Now l'll list the Pros: light weight, good Shimano gears, looks very nice. Cons: cheap & not very durable seat post clamp & brake caliper. Side note: my rim came slightly bent.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Have had this bike for a year now and..
customer_reviews.text: I love it. I still get compliments on my bike and I can keep up with some of my friends who are into the racing scene (I am not). I have probably put about 800-1000 miles on it already and it's still chugging away amazingly. Probably the best money I've spent on a bike ever (coming from years of buying walmart bikes). For some data: I'm 6' and bought the 22" model. It fits me very well, though I could see myself fitting onto the 25" decently enough.
customer_reviews.author: llama glama

customer_reviews.title: Great! But more weight then I thought
customer_reviews.text: The bike actually weighs about 27 or so pounds. The tires have minor treading (I thought they were racing slicks) but it was pretty nice to have in wet weather. Great speeds, great and easy adjustments, totally worth buying.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Clark

customer_reviews.title: So far so good. Had to adjust the front brakes as everyone ...
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Had to adjust the front brakes as everyone else indicated and get used to the shifting. Saddle is comfortable enough. pretty light for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie

customer_reviews.title: Road Bike on a Budget
customer_reviews.text: Great road bike if you are on a budget. The frame is light and solid. First thing I will upgrade will be the seat and brakes.
customer_reviews.author: RedWinter

customer_reviews.title: Love the bike
customer_reviews.text: Love the bike. First road bike in a long time. I am riding every day and find it very enjoyable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great bike at a great price
customer_reviews.text: Shipping was fast, did not take long to put it together. I ride on the weekends, so far I have ridden about 60 miles w/no problems. Do recommend the bike and the seller...
customer_reviews.author: Sameer

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good bike. I am a beginner and ride about 50-60 miles a week.
customer_reviews.author: Ishaan

customer_reviews.title: Good bike for the price
customer_reviews.text: Bought this bike in August of 2013. I have put about 75 miles on it. I have had to adjust the gears and breaks but that was expected. As a beginner, this was a good choice considering the local bike shop's entry level bikes were more than twice the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy B.

customer_reviews.title: Good bike
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this bike, eveerything is good just the front derailleur has a rattling sound. Customer service representative help me replace the defective part. It's very helpful. Light weight bike and amazing
customer_reviews.author: Harold

customer_reviews.title: Nice bike for the cash.
customer_reviews.text: Received the bike timely and in good condition. Easy to put together. Only handlebars,seat and pedals really. Took me longer to take all the tape off the bike. I suggest taking it to the shop for tune up. Rides nice.
customer_reviews.author: Dman2011

customer_reviews.title: i love this bike my first to but dont like how ...
customer_reviews.text: i love this bike my first to but dont like how the crank arm keeps coming loose the left shiter an gear lleaver ratels an with the rim jone to were the seem is ccoming abpart will have to buy anothwer pair soon
customer_reviews.author: Trevor

customer_reviews.title: So far so good. Rode it for the first time yesterday only ...
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Rode it for the first time yesterday only a 10 mile ride but it shifts great I have to get use to the feel of it. Meaning you can feel every imperfection in the road surface. I'll update when I put more miles on it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This bike came without a manual so I cannot have a total understanding of the operation of this bike
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great deal
customer_reviews.text: This is a surprising good deal for the price. I bought this to be used as an indoor trainer. But after receiving it, I will use it for winter training as well.
customer_reviews.author: inkeba

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: Overall, good for the price, however, needed to change the tires and brakes after first week. I bike in to work everyday. Around 250KM/week. So far, after a month, no problem with the gears. Good frame and looks good. This is a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: ML Quebec-Canada

customer_reviews.title: Great intermediate bike
customer_reviews.text: Had the bike shipped to a bike shop and had it setup by the pros. I rode it in several events and the only problem was keeping up with the spokes rusting. Actually sold it for more than I paid for it, when I upgraded to a $5,000 bike.
customer_reviews.author: Hannelore Brodie

customer_reviews.title: For the price this bike is fine. My really expensive Marin carbon 105
customer_reviews.text: For the price this bike is fine. My really expensive Marin carbon 105, got stolen and I needed a quick replacement. This did the trick. Sure its a tank, but fine for the casual group rides. Needs tuning in the cable department (out of box will hunt gears), also your probably going to want a different seat and stem. The tubes in it are schrader not presta, I missed that in description. Hopefully the wheels/tires will accept a presta when a tube goes out. On bright side I have 200-300 miles on this bike now and have not had a flat.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.text: 5/5 Price 4/5 Quality 4/5 Weight 5/5 Durability 5/5 Utility Overall, I've never gotten more 'bang for my buck' in a bike than I have with this one. Lately the prices appear to have gone up, but at $350, I don't think I can find a better bike.
customer_reviews.author: Consumerist

customer_reviews.title: Good Bike
customer_reviews.text: I like this bike. Its not too heavy. As usual with bikes out of the box, there is some adjustment needed. Once you get it right though, its fun to ride, fast, and nimble. As I'm sure there are better bikes out there, this is a good bike for the price. I am happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Arturo Ramirez

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Am enjoying this bike. Was exactly what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel T Dixon

customer_reviews.title: Really good entry level bike

customer_reviews.title: Major manufacturing defect
customer_reviews.text: After putting together the Giordano Libero Road Bike, I discovered a major manufacturing flaw. In assembly, they had switched the cables for the front brakes and the gear shifter, making both inoperable. Needless to say, it made the bicycle unrideable and dangerous. While I am sure this defect does not occur on every bike, it does not instill confidence in the manufacturer or their quality control. I will give credit to Amazon, though - the return process went smoothly and my refund appeared in my account the same morning I dropped off the box at a UPS store.

This stunning Italian inspired road bike packs a powerful punch without breaking the bank and is certain to remain a favorite weapon for novice cyclists looking to speed past the competition. Available in Men's Small, Medium and Large. Small- 50cm/20" fits riders 5'1"-5'8" with a stand over of 28"-30". Medium 56cm/22" fits riders 5'8"-6'0" with a stand over of 30"-32". Large 61cm/25infits riders 6'2"-6'5" with a stand over of 33"-35". Professional Assembly is recommended for your safety and riding enjoyment.
